casebody.data:
Paul W. Latham Respondent v. Patrick B. Delany Appellant. Decided July 2, 1891. Appeal from judgment entered in favor of the plaintiff upon the verdict of a jury *591and, from order denying defendant’s motion for a new trial. E. Louis Lowe, for appellant. William C. Davis, for respondent.

Before Freedman, Dugro and Gilder-sleeve, JJ.

The question involved was one of fact. The Court (Freedman, J. writing, Dugro and Gilder-sleeve, JJ., concurring) held that the evidence supported the verdict, and affirmed the judgment and order, with costs.
